name: Angelina Stonecrop
climate: Angelina Stonecrop thrives in temperate climates where it can experience seasonal changes.
This plant is well-suited for Mediterranean climates that offer dry summers and mild, wet winters.
It can also be grown in continental climates where cold winters and warm summers are typical.
Angelina Stonecrop adapts well to arid climates with low precipitation throughout the year.
sunlight: It requires full sunlight for at least six hours a day to maintain its vibrant foliage.
Partial shade is tolerable, but it may affect the intensity of the leaf coloration.
Direct sunlight exposure is essential for the plant's growth and overall health.
While able to handle shade in the hottest climates, it prefers mostly sunny conditions.
watering: Water sparingly, as Angelina Stonecrop is drought-tolerant and prefers dry conditions.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; ensure soil dries out between waterings.
In the growing season, water deeply but infrequently to encourage a strong root system.
During winter dormancy, reduce watering significantly and only water when soil is completely dry.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil mixtures that prevent waterlogging and support root health.
A sandy or gritty loam is ideal, minimizing the risk of moisture accumulation around roots.
This plant thrives in poor, rocky soils where nutrients are not overly abundant.
Amending soil with perlite or gravel improves drainage, simulating natural rocky habitats.
extra_care_tip: Prune back in early spring to maintain shape and encourage dense growth.
In colder climates, a layer of mulch can protect roots from freezing temperatures.
